results.title: Walt Disney Movie Viewer
results.brief_description:
Walt Disney Mettoy Viewer c. 1960
The first Movie Viewer was made in the USA in 1973 by Fisher Price. The British version was made by the Mettoy company. The viewer used Super 8 film and the actual clips were short pieces from real cartoon films. No technology was required to operate the viewer, not even batteries. The hand crank enabled the operator to view the film at any speed with the ability to go forwards or backwards at will.

results.title: De Facto
results.brief_description: An animated film to promote discussion. The ceremony of commissioning a new building is about to begin, but first it must be painted white to match its twin, which is located nearby. The people gather, the officials appear, the drummer beats his drum in noisy salute to the magnificent new building… and the building collapses. Who is to blame? The architect? The bricklayer? The carpenter? The painter? Finally a decision is reached. It was the drummer’s fault. The angry officials descend on the hapless drummer, take his drum and stomp on it. A loud triumphant cheer rings out from the crowd… and the second building falls down!

results.title: The Days the world went mad
results.creator_credit: Max Morgan-Witts and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: A documentary of natural disasters compiled from film footage gathered from all over the world. Earthquakes, tidal waves, eruptions, tornadoes and hurricanes are all recorded. Includes unique footage of the Alaskan earthquake.
results.description: A documentary of natural disasters compiled from film footage gathered from all over the world. Earthquakes, tidal waves, eruptions, tornadoes and hurricanes are all recorded. Includes unique footage of the Alaskan earthquake.

results.title: The Days of Whiskey Gap
results.creator_credit: Colin Low, Roman Kroitor, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The 1870s were years of grave crises in the Canadian West. American whiskey traders were victimizing the Indians. Chief Sitting Bull and his Sioux warriors, fresh from their victory over the US Cavalry, were camped near the Cypress Hills, and the stage was set for tragedy. In 1873, the North-West Mounted Police were established to maintain law and order in the newly acquired North-West Territories. The following summer a courageous expedition trekked 800 miles from Fort Dufferin, south of Winnipeg, to Fort Whoopup, near present-day Lethbridge. The force raised the flag and proclaimed the Queen’s law, ensuring that the Canadian West would not become a lawless American-style frontier. This film brings to life some of the legends of the men in the scarlet tunics.

results.title: Days of destruction
results.brief_description: Examines and chronicles the January, 1973 eruption of the volcano Eldfell on the Icelandic island of Aeimaey. Shows how scientists studied the eruption and documents the civil defence personnel and towns people as they attempted to save buildings from approaching lava flow. Depicts the evacuation of the 5,000 inhabitants, both by air and sea. Graphically captures scenes of bellowing craters, flowing lava and burning and collapsing buildings.

results.title: Daydreams (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Drawings by Anne Graham, and words by Peter Homewood, portray the thoughts of an old lady looking back on her life, recalling faces, places and associated events. One face eludes her faded memory, it is her own face in her youth.

results.title: The Daydreamer
results.brief_description: An example of independent Melbourne film production. A young man watching a girl pass by his window, imagines himself the hero in a series of fantastic situations in which the maiden’s honour is threatened by diverse evil characters. Made by Michael Martin, assisted by Garry Martin, Bruce McNaughton and Doug Hobbs.

results.title: Daybreak in Udi
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information and Crown Film Unit
results.brief_description: The Abaja Ibos, with the advice of the District Officer, in the Udi division of Nigeria, build a maternity home and show how ancient prejudices are overcome in the development of their territory.
